thread.title: Moto G5 Plus to launch on March 15 in India exclusively on Flipkart
thread.title_full: Moto G5 Plus to launch on March 15 in India exclusively on Flipkart

author: Mitja Rutnik
title: Moto G5 Plus to launch on March 15 in India exclusively on Flipkart
text:
Lenovo took the wraps off the Moto G5 Plus at MWC in Barcelona about a week ago. The smartphone will soon be available in India and will make its debut on March 15. Unlike the previous Moto G series, it will be sold exclusively on Flipkart, and not on Amazon.
The smartphone is available in a few different variants and for now, there’s no word on which one will launch in India. The price also remains a mystery for now but will be announced on March 15, along with all the other details.
As a refresher, the Moto G5 Plus sports a 5.2-inch Full HD display and is powered by the Snapdragon 625 chipset. It comes with 2, 3, or 4 GB of RAM and 32, or 64 GB of storage, which is expandable (up to 128 GB). You’ll find a 12 MP camera on the back with an f/1.7 aperture and a selfie snapper on the front that has a 5 MP sensor.
See also: Moto G5 and G5 Plus hands on: bringing premium looks to the mid-range 1 week ago Other features of the smartphone include a 3,000 mAh battery, a front-mounted fingerprint reader, and a USB Type-C port. It runs Android 7.0 Nougat with a custom user interface on top.
If you want to get the device as soon as it is released, we advise you to visit Flipkart’s website and sign up to get notified as soon as the Moto G5 Plus becomes available. To do so, click on the button below.
Sign up
